items.title: These are the most active investors in China’s startups
items.summary:
- The article lists the most active investors in China-based startups over the past two years.
- Investors are ranked by the number of deals they have completed.
- Only firms that have invested in three or more companies in China within the past 12 months are featured.
- The data is subject to updates and corrections from funds that notice inaccuracies.
- For more information on investor funding data, readers can follow a provided link.

items.title: Defense firm Saronic secures $600m series C
items.summary:
- Saronic Technologies raised US$600 million in its series C funding round, increasing its valuation to US$4 billion.
- The funding round was led by investor Elad Gil, occurring seven months after Saronic achieved unicorn status.
- Funds will be allocated to construct Port Alpha, a shipyard for building autonomous ships primarily for defense.
- The facility aims to tackle US shipbuilding capacity challenges and focus on developing medium and large Autonomous Surface Vessels (ASVs) for the US Navy’s hybrid fleet.

items.title: Meta settles Israeli privacy lawsuit for $338k
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms has agreed to pay approximately US$338,000 to settle a lawsuit filed in Israel.
- The lawsuit accused Meta of misusing phone numbers used for two-step verification for advertising purposes.
- Meta denied the claims but settled after court-recommended mediation, updating its policy to use these phone numbers solely for security.
- The settlement funds will support the Israel Class Action Fund, compensating users directly was deemed impractical.
- The Central District Court approved the settlement, finding it fair and reasonable, while Meta did not admit liability.

items.title: Russian internet firm Yandex reports 37% growth, plans dividends
items.summary:
- Yandex reported over 1 trillion roubles (US$11.22 billion) in revenue for 2024, a 37% increase year-over-year.
- The company anticipates at least 30% growth in 2025.
- Yandex sold Russia-based assets for US$5.4 billion in July 2024, significant post-invasion of Ukraine.
- Despite changes, Yandex continues to be a major player in Russia's search and advertising markets.
- It operates ride-hailing services in parts of Africa and Europe, but has restricted access in the US.
- Under new ownership, Yandex plans to pay dividends for the first time, proposing 80 roubles (US$0.91) per share.

items.title: Indian-based ice cream brand Noto raises $40.8m
items.author: Varun Sheth, Ashni Shah
items.summary:
- Noto Ice Cream raised 15 crore rupee (US$40.84 million) in funding led by Inflection Point Ventures (IPV).
- Funding will support expansion into tier 1 and tier 2 cities, development of new summer flavors, and enhanced marketing.
- Founded in 2019, Noto operates in Mumbai, Delhi, Bangalore, and Hyderabad, with plans to expand to Ahmedabad, Kolkata, and Lucknow.
- Noto specializes in low-calorie, low-sugar ice cream, available on platforms like Swiggy, Zomato, and Flipkart.
- The Indian ice cream market is valued at 228.6 billion rupee (US$6.21 billion) in 2023, with growth expected in healthier, premium options.

items.title: Australian children bypass social media age limits: report
items.summary:
- Australian children are circumventing age restrictions set by social media platforms.
- The report indicates a significant number of minors are accessing these platforms despite the age limit of 13 years.
- Concerns are raised about the potential risks associated with underage users engaging on social media.

items.title: Dubai’s Mansa secures $10m to expand stablecoin payments
items.summary:
- Dubai-based startup Mansa raised US$10 million in seed funding for cross-border stablecoin payments.
- Funding includes US$3 million in equity from Tether and additional debt financing.
- Mansa facilitates instant transaction settlement and account funding with stablecoins, aiming to expand into Latin America and Southeast Asia to address liquidity issues.

items.title: UAE-based tech services firm Alpha Data plans $163.2m IPO
items.summary:
- Alpha Data plans to raise up to US$163.2 million through an IPO, marking Abu Dhabi’s first IPO of 2023.
- The company aims to list 400 million shares priced between 1.45 and 1.50 dirhams (US$0.39 - US$0.41) each, valuing the firm at up to US$408 million.
- Subscription opens on February 20 and closes on February 25, with trading expected to start around March 11.
- Alpha Data projects a dividend payout of 130 million dirhams (US$35.4 million) for 2025.
- The company reported a net profit of 127 million dirhams (US$34.58 million) and revenue of 2.32 billion dirhams (US$631.65 million) for 2024.

items.title: East Ventures unveils platform for AI innovators in Indonesia
items.summary:
- East Ventures launched IndoBuild AI, a platform for promoting AI innovation in Indonesia.
- The initiative aims to connect AI talents and industry stakeholders for practical AI solutions.
- The program starts with a workshop on February 26, led by experts from AWS, Alibaba Cloud, and Google.
- Participants have until March 5 to develop their solutions.
- Shortlisted innovators will be announced on March 10, with a Demo Day on March 13.
- Two winners will receive cash prizes and additional benefits.

items.title: BYD Korea plans hybrid cars to attract middle-aged buyers
items.summary:
- BYD Korea aims to introduce hybrid vehicles targeting middle-aged consumers.
- The strategy is part of an effort to expand its market footprint in South Korea.
- Hybrid vehicles are expected to appeal to buyers who prioritize fuel efficiency and environmental considerations.

items.title: Dixon expects revenue to double as India’s tech grows
items.summary:
- Dixon Technologies, major assembler for Google’s Pixel smartphones, expects revenue to double this fiscal year.
- Reported revenue for FY ending March 2024 is 177.13 billion rupees (US$2.04 billion), a 45% increase from the prior year.
- Revenue for nine months ending Dec. 31, 2024, reached 285.77 billion rupees.
- Growth driven by rapid expansion of electronics manufacturing in India as global firms shift supply chains from China.
- Challenges arise with potential US tariffs planned for April, which could impact India's exports by US$7 billion annually.

items.title: South Korea boosts AI development with $4.18b investment
items.author: Choi Sang-mok
items.summary:
- South Korean Acting President Choi Sang-mok announced plans to position the country as a top three global leader in AI.
- Establishment of a national AI team and funding for a competitive large-scale language model (LLM) were outlined.
- A 1 trillion won (US$695 million) AI research initiative will secure proprietary AI technologies and cultivate talent.
- Fast-tracking of the 2 trillion won (US$1.39 billion) National AI Computing Center to acquire 10,000 GPUs by 2025.
- Introduction of tax incentives and expanded access to public and industrial data for AI and cloud businesses.
- A 3 trillion won (US$2.09 billion) AI startup fund will assist 100 specialized AI firms by 2027, focusing on health care and legal services.

items.title: Rivals feel ripples of eFishery fiasco
items.summary:
* eFishery, a unicorn in Indonesia's aquatech sector, is facing an internal fraud case that puts its future at risk.
* The situation has created skepticism in the aquatech industry, affecting rival firms and investor sentiment.
* Rivals acknowledge the challenges of competing against industry giants such as Charoen Pokphand and Japfa for market share.

items.title: Roll-up firm Una Brands loses co-founder CEO
items.author: Kiren Tanna, Cho Weihao
items.summary:
- Kiren Tanna, co-founder and CEO of Una Brands, resigned after over four years.
- Cho Weihao, the former CFO, has taken over the CEO role.
- Tanna resigned from the boards of 26 Una Brands SPVs on January 14.
- Una Brands aims for a strategic shift towards profitability and sustainable growth.
- In 2023, the company reported a 4.8% revenue growth to US$43 million but a 4.2% increase in losses to US$78 million.
- Una Brands achieved EBITDA profitability in Q4 2023 and has halted acquisitions for over a year to focus on profitability.
- Founded in 2017, Una Brands acquires established retail firms generating US$300,000 to US$20 million in annual revenue.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s fintech startups?
items.summary:
- The article discusses the most active investors in Southeast Asia's fintech scene over the past two years.
- A list is provided, ranking firms by the number of deals made, focusing on those that invested in three or more startups in the region.
- The data is continuously updated and aims to provide insights on the impact of each investor in the fintech sector.
- Readers are encouraged to report any inaccuracies regarding their funding information.

items.title: Lenovo revenue up 20%, profit doubles on AI
items.summary:
- Lenovo's quarterly net income more than doubled to US$692.7 million in the December quarter.
- Revenue increased by 20% to US$18.8 billion, exceeding projections.
- Strong growth in the server division largely driven by rising demand for AI services.

items.title: US Commerce agency to cut 500 jobs in chips, AI sector
US Commerce agency to cut 500 probationary jobs
items.summary:
- The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) plans to terminate around 500 probationary employees due to federal budget cuts.
- Layoffs communicated verbally to staff on Feb. 19, according to anonymous sources.
- Approximately 60% of employees on US$39 billion manufacturing incentive programs and two-thirds involved in US$11 billion research and development may be affected.

items.title: SolarEdge beats revenue estimates despite Q4 loss
items.summary:
- SolarEdge reported a Q4 loss of US$3.52 per share, worse than the expected US$1.66 loss.
- The company generated US$25.5 million in positive cash flow, a significant rebound from a US$180 million loss in 2023.
- Revenue reached US$196 million, slightly beating forecasts but down 17% year-over-year.
- Operating expenses were reduced by US$10 million to US$106 million in Q4, with expected further reductions in Q1 2025.
- The company restructured leadership and closed its South Korean energy storage division to cut costs after two years of inventory challenges.

items.title: Taiwanese AI server makers to invest in US this May
items.summary:
- Taiwanese AI server manufacturers are set to make investments in the United States this May.
- The move signifies a push towards expanding their presence in the US market.
- The investment aims to bolster partnerships and enhance technological collaborations.

items.title: Nio denies job cut rumors
items.summary:
- Nio, the Chinese electric vehicle manufacturer, denied rumors of a 50% workforce reduction, calling them "utterly absurd" on Feb. 19.
- The company's legal team has reported the matter to authorities.
- Nio continues to hire and encourages job seekers to visit its WeChat account under "Nio Recruitment".

items.title: Israeli AI video startup Guidde raises $15m series A
items.author: Yoav Einav, Dan Sahar
items.summary:
- Guidde raises $15 million in series A funding led by Qualcomm Ventures.
- Other investors include Norwest Venture Partners, Entrée Capital, Honeystone Ventures, and Tiferes Ventures.
- Launch of Guidde Broadcast, a platform for AI-driven video training.
- Reports a fourfold revenue increase in the past year, serving over 100,000 users across 2,000 organizations such as American Eagle and Nasdaq.
- Founded by Yoav Einav and Dan Sahar, with over 50 employees primarily in Ramat Gan, Israel.

items.title: Zuckerberg lobbies for Meta’s $65b AI vision in US Senate
items.author: Mark Zuckerberg
items.summary:
- Mark Zuckerberg met with senators on Feb. 19 to discuss AI and American tech leadership.
- Meta plans to invest up to $65 billion in AI projects this year, focusing on smart glasses and headsets.
- Discussions included AI regulations, although specific senators involved were not disclosed.
- Meta is resisting EU regulations like the Digital Services Act, which addresses harmful content on social platforms.
- Zuckerberg's visit emphasizes Meta's strategy to navigate regulatory challenges while expanding its AI efforts.

items.title: Apple’s first custom modem chip debuts in iPhone 16e
items.summary:
- Apple has officially introduced its first custom modem chip, featured in the iPhone 16e.
- This advancements aims to enhance connectivity and performance in the device.
- The launch marks a strategic shift for Apple as it seeks to reduce reliance on third-party suppliers for modem technology.

items.title: Alibaba to release earnings after $110b stock rally
items.summary:
- Alibaba will release earnings on Feb. 20 after a $110 billion stock rally since January.
- The rally is attributed to interest in AI initiatives, Jack Ma's re-engagement, and a partnership with Apple.
- Despite the rally, Alibaba faces challenges from market competition and a slowing Chinese economy.
- Alibaba Cloud's revenue is expected to grow 9.7% this quarter.
- Investors expect stock volatility with increased options trading volume.

items.title: Google moves Gemini to standalone app on iOS
items.summary:
- Google removes AI assistant Gemini from the main Google app on iOS, directing users to download the standalone app.
- The standalone version of Gemini offers voice interactions, AI-generated summaries, and integration with Google services like YouTube and Gmail.
- Users are warned about potential errors in Gemini's responses and are encouraged to verify them.

items.title: US-based fertility insurance firm launches money-back plan
items.summary:
- Future Family, a US-based company, has launched Orange Shield, an IVF insurance product supported by Munich Re Ventures.
- The plan covers up to two IVF cycles, costing $3,000 upfront plus $999 monthly for five months, with potential refunds if treatment fails.
- Coverage is available at select clinics nationwide, with eligibility based on age, medical history, and lifestyle factors; patients over 38 using their own eggs are ineligible, but donor egg recipients may qualify.
- Founded in 2016, Future Family has assisted over 10,000 families and allocated $200 million in credit.

items.title: Italy plans to develop satellite system to rival Starlink
items.summary:
- The Italian government is developing a low-orbit satellite system for secure communications.
- This initiative aims to create a domestic alternative to SpaceX's Starlink.
- National stakeholders will be engaged, and the Italian Space Agency will conduct a feasibility study.
- Specific timelines and involved companies have not been disclosed.

items.title: Blockchain firm Fluent Labs secures $8m seed funding
items.summary:
- Fluent Labs, a blockchain development company, raised US$8 million in seed funding led by Polychain Capital.
- Participants include Primitive, dao5, Symbolic Capital, Builder Capital, Nomad Capital, Public Works, and angel investors like Balaji Srinivasan, Mustafa Al-Bassam, and Santiago Santos.
- The funding supports the development of an Ethereum Layer 2 platform to integrate various virtual machine environments into a single execution network.
- Fluent Labs plans to expand its 17-member engineering team and build infrastructure for its testnet.

items.title: EFishery’s woes push banks to rethink startup loans
items.summary:
- HSBC's US$1 billion ASEAN Growth Fund is aimed at new economy businesses like eFishery, which is currently facing a fraud scandal.
- The issues with eFishery might cause banks to tighten their lending policies towards startups.
- Despite its problems, eFishery has reportedly repaid all bank loans totaling US$77 million and confirmed no current exposure to banks like DBS and HSBC.
- The scandal included allegations of eFishery overstating its revenue by nearly US$600 million and reporting a substantial loss of US$157 million.
- The incident highlights ongoing challenges for banks in assessing startup risks and returns, given their unique operational dynamics.

items.title: Japan’s startup funding, as explained in charts
SingPost to lay off 45 employees ‘in the coming months’
items.summary:
- Singapore Post (SingPost) will lay off 45 employees due to company restructuring, as announced on February 19.
- Affected employees are mainly from corporate support units and a small number from the international business unit.
- The restructuring aims to rightsize, eliminate duplicate functions, and improve efficiency amid intense competition and prolonged macroeconomic challenges.

items.title: Trump says Musk’s India factory plans unfair to US
Ex-Flipkart VP joins Indian kids’ personal care brand
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Tuco Kids appoints Chanakya Gupta as cofounder.
- Gupta has experience from Flipkart and Curefit, focusing on scaling consumer businesses.
- He previously served as business head at Cult Play and chief HR officer at Curefit.
- His past roles at Flipkart included VP of strategic partnerships and private brands.
- Tuco Kids recently secured US$2 million in seed funding in 2024, co-led by Fireside Ventures and Whiteboard Capital.
- The brand, founded by Aishvarya Murali in 2023, offers sustainable products for children aged 3 to 13, available on its website, Amazon, and Flipkart.

items.title: Microsoft launches AI model for video games
Taiwan presidential advisor refutes Trump’s chip theft claim
Ex-Intel execs raise $21.5m for chip startup AheadComputing
DeepSeek denied external funding, called it ‘purely rumors’
items.summary:
- DeepSeek denies reports of seeking external funding, labeling them as 'purely rumors'.
- Claims of interest came from Alibaba and China Investment Corporation (CIC).
- Company has not confirmed any plans to raise funds despite reports suggesting a need to meet growing AI demand.
- DeepSeek has been relying on parent company funding and government grants.
- Alibaba has denied the rumors of a US$1 billion investment.

items.title: Japan targets 40-50% renewables in energy mix by 2040
items.summary:
- Japan aims for renewables to make up 40-50% of its energy mix by fiscal 2040, increasing from 36-38% for 2030.
- The energy plan allocates 30-40% to thermal power and about 20% to nuclear energy, promoting next-generation nuclear reactors.
- The strategy addresses rising electricity demand, driven by AI, while ensuring energy stability and lower carbon emissions, without reducing reliance on nuclear power.

items.title: Apple reveals iPhone 16e with AI features for $599
items.summary:
- Apple has launched the iPhone 16e, a budget smartphone priced at $599, aimed at mid-market consumers in China and India.
- It features a 6.1-inch display, Face ID, AI capabilities via the A18 chip, and a 48-megapixel camera with a zoom lens, but lacks a wide-angle lens.
- The iPhone 16e is $200 cheaper than the base model of iPhone 16 and introduces Apple’s C1 chip, replacing Qualcomm modems.
- The device includes a USB-C port to comply with EU regulations, marking Apple's entry into the budget segment.
- Pre-orders for the iPhone 16e begin on February 21, with shipments starting February 28.

items.title: Google debuts AI tool to assist scientific research
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Google has introduced a new AI tool aimed at enhancing scientific research workflows.
- The tool is designed to help researchers with data analysis, literature review, and collaborative efforts.
- It aims to accelerate scientific discoveries and improve research efficiency.

items.title: Indian solar financing firm Credit Fair secures $5m green debt
items.author: Aditya Damani
items.summary:
- Credit Fair raises US$5 million in debt financing from Symbiotics Investments.
- The funding is part of a US$75 million green bond backed by British International Investment.
- Capital will be used to expand rooftop solar financing for residential and MSME customers.
- The company has supported over 8,000 customers, reducing over 4,100 tonnes of carbon emissions.
- Credit Fair was founded in 2018 by Aditya Damani and is registered with the Reserve Bank of India.

items.title: Hydrogen truck maker Nikola files for bankruptcy
items.summary:
- Nikola Corporation filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Feb. 19 due to failure in securing funding or finding a buyer.
- Once valued at $30 billion after a SPAC merger in 2020, the company faced a decline amid legal issues and reputational damage.
- Founder Trevor Milton was convicted of wire and securities fraud in 2022.
- The bankruptcy includes plans to auction off assets, including hydrogen fuel cell and battery-powered truck platforms.
- Nikola reported $47 million in cash to finance the bankruptcy after a failed $100 million stock sale in December 2024.
- CEO Steve Girsky stated that external economic challenges made Chapter 11 the best option.
- The company warned that cash reserves would only last until early 2025.

items.title: TikTok ecommerce targets 400% growth in US by 2025
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- TikTok aims to achieve 400% growth in ecommerce in the US by 2025.
- The platform is expanding its offerings to capture a larger share of the ecommerce market.
- Strategies will likely include enhancing user engagement and leveraging content creators for sales.

items.title: Google pays $340m to settle tax dispute with Italy
items.summary:
- Google has agreed to pay €340 million (approximately $340 million) to settle a tax dispute with Italy.
- The settlement represents a resolution of issues spanning several years regarding allegations of unpaid taxes.
- The move is part of broader efforts by the Italian government to clamp down on tax evasion by large multinational corporations.

items.title: Indian menstrual care firm Healthfab nets $1m pre-series A
items.author: Kiriti Acharjee, Sourav Chakrabarty, Satyajit Chakraborty
items.summary:
- Healthfab raised US$1 million in pre-series A funding.
- The funding round was led by Mistry Ventures with participation from BeyondSeed, Thrive Ventures, and individual investors.
- Healthfab specializes in sustainable menstrual products, including India's first reusable period panty, GoPadFree, certified by the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS).

items.title: DeepSeek seeks funding, attracts Alibaba, state investors
items.summary:
- Chinese AI firm DeepSeek is seeking external funding for the first time.
- Attracting interest from Alibaba and government-backed entities like China Investment Corp and the National Social Security Fund.
- The company faced resource strains and service outages, highlighting the need for funding for AI chips and servers.
- DeepSeek executives may explore new revenue-generating business models.
- This initiative aligns with China's push to enhance technological capabilities.
- No specific details on potential funding arrangements have been disclosed.

items.title: Nigeria sues Binance for $79.5b in losses, unpaid taxes
items.summary:
- Nigeria initiates a lawsuit against Binance seeking US$79.5 billion in damages for alleged economic losses.
- An additional US$2 billion is sought for unpaid taxes from 2022 and 2023.
- The Federal Inland Revenue Service claims Binance is liable for corporate income taxes due to its significant economic presence in Nigeria, including penalties and interest on unpaid amounts.

items.title: These funds have not invested in Indonesia in the past year
items.summary:
- Funds which backed at least one Indonesian company in the past two years have not conducted funding rounds in the last 12 months.
- Possible reasons for halted investments could include waiting for better opportunities, shifting focus, or market de-prioritization.
- Emphasis on the importance of timing in outreach to investors.
- The database is continuously updated; users are encouraged to report inaccuracies via email.

items.title: Grab’s Q4 profit falls to $27m, but beats analyst estimates
items.summary:
- Grab reported a net profit of US$27 million for Q4 2024, down from US$35 million year-on-year.
- Earnings exceeded analyst estimates of US$10.3 million according to Bloomberg.
- Q4 revenue increased by 17% to US$764 million, surpassing the estimate of US$757.8 million.
- The company's adjusted EBITDA reached US$97 million, compared to US$35 million the previous year.
- On-demand GMV grew 20% YoY to US$5 billion, driven by user and transaction growth.
- Adjusted free cash flow was US$61 million, up from US$1 million in Q4 2023.
- For the full year, loss narrowed to US$105 million from US$434 million, with total revenue rising to US$2.8 billion.
